title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=c6623226acf7856bb5a61313af7bec382c8525f1
comments:
Given the sorry state of tech content on Youtube, I started the TechCynics Podcast with a friend of mine covering weekly news with a cynical take, especially on web3, crypto, metaverse, and NFTs: [https://youtu.be/Q-0SHH7pgj8](https://youtu.be/Q-0SHH7pgj8). We also cover Automotive and Gaming stories.

Do let me know your thoughts. Timestamps are provided if you want to check out specific topics. We're on Google, Spotify, Apple, and Amazon Podcasts if you prefer an audio version.
Can one recommend me a good YouTube channel regarding geo politics from indian perspective
Anybody a fan of Viva La Dirt League [https://www.youtube.com/c/VivaLaDirtLeague]. A great parody on video games and its Bored series is also fun.

Mai ‐ Netflix

Guilty Minds - Prime Video
I liked them. Especially Guilty Minds because I like courtroom dramas.
Watched "Get Out" recently. It is a damn good movie.
Watched Ozark Series Finale and Dark Season 2.

I have a plug for my Youtube channel about Indian Movies/T.V. Series from the perspective of History and Mythology. For example, one of my videos, and I plan to make more, is about tracing the source of each episode from Bharat Ek Khoj, one of the best series made by the ace director Shyam Benegal. 
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCb7blKMLYcDmbdPg5FmGupw

light_cleaned_comments: Watched Runway 34 yday. It's a good one time watch. It stayed to the point - and while we may never know the story behind the pilots decision in the true story, it brings in a compelling argument. **Spoilers:** >!Still feel Amit Ji's role was a little bit overdone in terms of the aggression and approach to the situation - possibly the biggest detractor from making it feel real by presenting an almost villain-hero situation.!< Given the sorry state of tech content on Youtube, I started the TechCynics Podcast with a friend of mine covering weekly news with a cynical take, especially on web3, crypto, metaverse, and NFTs: [https://youtu.be/Q-0SHH7pgj8](https://youtu.be/Q-0SHH7pgj8). We also cover Automotive and Gaming stories. Do let me know your thoughts. Timestamps are provided if you want to check out specific topics. We're on Google, Spotify, Apple, and Amazon Podcasts if you prefer an audio version. Can one recommend me a good YouTube channel regarding geo politics from indian perspective Anybody a fan of Viva La Dirt League [https://www.youtube.com/c/VivaLaDirtLeague]. A great parody on video games and its Bored series is also fun. Mai ‐ Netflix Guilty Minds - Prime Video Were they any good? I liked them. Especially Guilty Minds because I like courtroom dramas. Series from the perspective of History and Mythology. For example, one of my videos, and I plan to make more, is about tracing the source of each episode from Bharat Ek Khoj, one of the best series made by the ace director Shyam Benegal.
